newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ericsson to launch 6-10 new phones a year - paper.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson to launch 6-10 new phones a year - paper.

text.p: Swedish telecoms group Ericsson will launch between six and 10 new mobile telephones annually instead of one per year as previously, daily Finanstidningen reported on Friday.
"The sharply higher rate of product launches is a response to more differentiated customer needs," the newspaper said.
Ericsson has divided its mobile phone customers into five segments, each needing its own phone functionality and design, Finanstidningen said.
Ericsson launched three new phones on Thursday, GH688 with many features, GA628 for young people and GS18 for data communication, the daily said.
But the company still has problems meeting demand for the GF788 which it started selling in March.
"We have enormous amounts of orders on GF788 and it is like a black hole," Par Sveen, head of Ericsson's Swedish mobile phones operations, was quoted as saying.
"Production runs around the clock but all we manufacture immediately disappears. In the month of June we hope to have caught up with deliveries."
The delivery problems are just as big in other countries, the newspaper said.
If Ericsson failed to meet demand for the new models for a couple of months it would be hard to compensate for that later as the telephones' lifespan has become shorter, it said.
"Previously, a mobile phone could have a lifespan of maybe one to one and a half years," Sveen was quoted as saying.
"Now the lifespan is shorter and it keeps falling."
